description: Write n in base 4 and juxtapose.
comments: An irregular table in which the n-th row lists the base 4 digits of n. - _Jason Kimberley_, Nov 26 2012The base 4 Champernowne constant: it is normal in base 4. - _Jason Kimberley_, Nov 26 2012
links: F. J. Aragon Artacho, D. H. Bailey, J. M. Borwein, and P. B. Borwein, Walking on real numbers, preprint September 2012.
mathematica: Flatten[IntegerDigits[Range[40],4]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Aug 23 2011 *)almostNatural[n_, b_] := Block[{m = 0, d = n, i = 1, l, p}, While[m <= d, l = m; m = (b - 1) i*b^(i - 1) + l; i++]; i--; p = Mod[d - l, i]; q = Floor[(d - l)/i] + b^(i - 1); If[p != 0, IntegerDigits[q, b][[p]], Mod[q - 1, b]]]; Array[ almostNatural[#, 4] &, 105] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jun 29 2014 *)
